resources.string: The recommended recovery method for concussions follows the \"return to play\" guidelines as described here:
0% - At this level, no activity is recommended, and the patient should remain at rest in order to recover.
20% - At this level, light aerobic exercise to determine the effects of increased heart rate (Walking, etc…) is recommended, for shorter periods of time (20 minutes).
40% - At this level, sport-specific exercise (Jogging, etc…) is recommended to add movement, and assess movement ability.
60% - Non-contact Training drills: this looks for effects of exercise, as well as assessing the coordination and cognitive load of the patient.
80% - Full-Contact Practice: The goal of this stage is to restore patient confidence, and to assess functional skills of the patient.
